intro: Mappia origanoides, commonly known as the mountain savory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats. Mappia origanoides is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
